reviewText: [Update] You MUST check out Stevie's LIVE performance in Chicago and you can by logging on to Stevie's site [...] and click on the Chris Isaak Hour link.The POWER of the MUSIC in this epic live concert is absolutely OUTSTANDING. It's the best of Stevie times 1000.You also get a really cool "preview" from Warner Bros when you pre-order the DVD.Stevie is as phenomenal now as she always was. Everything that makes her music, songs, gorgeous inside and out - STEVIE NICKS rocks the house. Her solo career is amazing because SHE is amazing.Yes, get this DVD and I also recommend "Crystal Visions... The Very Best of Stevie Nicks" to go along with it.Great music that never gets old, no matter how old we get.Amazing icon she is as she deserves to be!
summary: Stevie Nicks - OUTSTANDING, Timeless and Fantastic as Ever

reviewText: This is Stevie Nicks and her band at their best!!!! This is one super outstanding concert dvd. Everything is first class!!! The atmosphere is great and the audience is really into it, making this one special concert!!! You get 17 great songs, plus a bonus track. Stevie does an excellent job of explaining the background or "story" behind the songs she performs. Her lead guitar player (Waddy) is simply awesome, and her band & background singers are fantastic.The songs are as follows:Stand BackEnchantedIf Anyone Falls in LoveRhiannonCrash Into Me - the Dave Matthews Song, and Stevie does an excellent job performing it.DreamsSorcererThe OneGold Dust WomanI Need to Know - The Tom Petty Song, Again, an outstanding performance by Stevie.Circle DanceLandside - This one she dedicates to her late father. During the Song there are pictures of him on the big screens. Stevie does an excellent tribute to him. You can feel Stevie's sencerity. "This one's for you Daddy" and again, Stevie does an excellcent perfomance.SaraFall From GraceHow Still My LoveEdge of Seventeen (Simply Outstanding!!!!)Rock & RollThe total running time is approximately 119 minutes. You get a bonus track of "Landslide" (Orchestra Version), and it is very good also. Overall, this is Stevie Nicks at her best!!! If you like Stevie, you'd better buy this one, because it doesn't get any better than this. You'll love it, I know I do!!!! Thanks!!!!
summary: The Best Stevie Nicks DVD Ever!!!!!! Simply Enchanted From Beginning to End!!!!!!

reviewText: It's a little over-produced but very intimate and an excellent show!  I love how Stevie takes care to explain the songs.  The only reason I purchased the DVD instead of the Blu-Ray was the track listing.  The DVD includes "Sorcerer" and "Dreams," but the track listing for the Blu-Ray does not include these tracks.  When this show originally aired on PBS those tracks were not included (presumably for time-length?).
summary: A Fantastic Show!  Stevie is Fabulous as Always!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Stevie Nicks releases her first solo concert on video since the 1986 "Red Rocks/Rock A Little" release! But this time, it's a full two hour show, and no fake close-ups!! Nicks burns through an amazing set of classic hits as well as some covers of Dave Matthews, "Crash into you," and Led Zep's "Rock and Roll." Filmed in Chicago, 2008, for the PBS SOUNDSTAGE program, this is what fans of the Queen of Rock have been waiting for! Stevie looks stunning, in shape, and in good voice here. Starting out with a twirling BANG with "Stand Back," Nicks looks happy and full of animated energy. Classic hits, including rarely performed smashes like "If anyone falls," and "Sara" and the return of back-up singer(and sister in law) Lori Nicks make this extra sweet! This release will be a long-time favorite of mine for years to come!
summary: The Queen of Rock in a great new concert

reviewText: Way Better than PSB Soundstage version. This has more songs, different shots and longer explanations of the songs  then what I saw on PBS. It's excellent. It's one of the best things she has ever done. I like the live album too, but DVD is absolutely stellar. She is great in concert. She kicks, twirls and claws at the air and sounds great! Her version of Crash is awesome.
summary: She kicks, twirls and claws at the air. She's rocking!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Watching Stevie Nicks whirl about the stage in her latest concert DVD, it's flat-out impossible to believe that the "queen of rock and roll" is past 60. She looks half her age and sings and acts like it, too. This is easily the best "official" concert video she's ever done, better than "Stevie Nicks in Concert" (1981) and "Stevie Live at Red Rocks" (1986, which had to be extensively reshot because at the time it was originally filmed, she was in terrible shape due to her substance-abuse problems at that point). She's in a good place these days, and does she ever show it; she's happy to be on stage, happy to be in front of her devoted fans, happy to be singing her classic songs. The 17-song set list is a really ecletic mix from her career plus several covers (I'd never have dreamed back when I first became a fan of hers a quarter of a century ago that she'd one day cover Led Zeppelin's "Rock and Roll" regularly live, but she does!) If you have bootleg tapes, pitch them, because this is the real deal. :) Impossible to recommend it too highly!!
summary: It's a lie - this woman can't be 60-plus!!! :)

reviewText: Is this country or rock?  I do not care I just want more of it.The performance was superb and the audio and video quality was closer to blu ray than your typical mdvd is.  I got this as a fix to the need for more Fleetwood Mac after owning The Dance mdvd.  I realize her solo is different and really wished she had done more Fleetwood Mac material.Well bar hold none this is THE best Stevie Nicks I have ever seen.  I have seen her in concert too.  Her personality flowed so natural on this one with her best of moods that night.  She was happy saying yes I can.I was left wishing Fleetwood Mac had jumped in for a few moments and raised a few songs for the encore but I guess that is just me.  I have several of her solo releases but this concert was just at another level in High End surround sound.  I play my blu ray and mdvd concerts in 5.1 and 7.2 simultaneously at well over 2k watts rms thx certified.A must have for any Fleetwood Mac or Stevie Nicks fan.  This one is the most played concert in my collection since I bought it.  Watch Stevie do her beautiful magic.  She says I am getting older too but you would not guess it by looking at her that's for sure.  Well I guess I am getting older too but she looks as hot as ever and then some in my eye.
summary: Super hot Stevie Nicks show with superb audio and video!

reviewText: stevie nicks does a duet with vanessa carlton on this dvd from her album ''the one.'' this dvd is a filmed show of stevie nicks second greatest hits album. she covers dave matthews ''crash into me'' , led zepplins ''rock and roll'' and bonnie raitts ''circle dance''. stevie wears her classic look, a black dress and her platform boots. when she performs ''landslide'' there is a slide show of her spending time with her fam, most of them shown are of her and her dad. she normally doesn't do the song ''sara'' in her solo set but she got a guilt letter and she agreed to perform sara so the guilt letters' feelings wouldn't be upset. stand back which kicks off her set near the end she kicks her right leg very high! that's a nice surprise! she can really rock!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Still amazing after all these years.  Actually, I'd say better than ever after all these years.The price of this DVD is justified simply to be able to hear Sara performed live.  I guess it wasn't performed live since 1979.  It is an amazing, very laid back version of Sara.I love how Stevie mixes things up with new endings to songs.  Gold Dust Woman has an interesting finish.I guess what amazes me most is that Stevie seems to have found new energy.  And her voice is truly better than it has ever been.  She is really belting out some of the songs while in the past I've always thought she was a bit reserved.The duets with Vanessa Carlton are amazing.  Duets prove how powerful a voice Stevie has because it can be mixed with another in harmonies and it still comes on in full force.This is the DVD of Stevie songs that is a most for any collection.  It is a far better mix of songs performed with Stevie at her peak.I have been listening to the CD and watching the DVD for two weeks and I had to come back and edit this review because I now truly believe this collect of songs in this performance is Stevie at her absolute best.As incredible as I believe Stevie's solo career has been, I have always believed she was at her absolute best when she was with Fleetwood Mac.  This solo performance changed that.
summary: Blown Away! The BEST Stevie Nicks performance ever.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've always loved Stevie's work, especially the songs she recorded with FM.  Some of it, mostly the portion prior to The Wild Heart, still holds up, but nowadays a lot of it sounds like it came from 80's night at the karaoke club.  Unfortunately, despite a very good set of session players, this performance looks back more than it looks forward.  While technically excellent, it only inspires through nostalgia.  I think these songs, and Stevie, deserve better.  I just wonder what might have been if Stevie had been able to rework some of those 80's hits for today.  Much like Lindsey's concert rendition of Big Love, I think she could've opened a keg of dynamite.  Instead, we have this - a nice concert, with nice players and nice songs but with very little fire.  Even Waddy's turned way down most of the time.To add insult, it sounds like there's lots of auto-tuning going on here.  I have no idea if it was applied live or if it was done after the fact, but Stevie has never had a pitch-perfect voice.  That's one of the things I love about her - she's definitely not of the American Idol generation!  Whatever the reasoning behind this aberration, it just doesn't sound right to me.  I prefer hearing her real voice.
summary: A Great Stevie Nicks Cover Band

reviewText: Someone involved in this lackluster production tried to bring Stevie back to her 1981 Bella Donna Tour concert heyday.  Even brought back Waddy Watchel on guitar--(never thought he could be bland, but here, he is)--even redid yet another performance of "I Need To Know".  Like all of Stevie's concerts over the past three decades, the song picks are mostly the same, the arrangements are exactly alike, and her vocalizations are word-for-word, sound-for-wailing sound.  Nothing new, nothing ventured, and nothing gained in this concert. I have loved Stevie since 1975, but feel cheated that she cannot attempt to produce a new show for her devotees, and feel as though she is just taking the lazy way out to make yet another dollar off the same old show.  Her lackluster, spiritless performance in this concert saddened me, and I will not watch this performance DVD again.  I'd rather watch the "original" version of this concert, the 1981 Bella Donna Tour (only available on VHS, to my knowledge), wherein she had all of the charm and spirit of a performer singing a new, beloved show for her audience.  I'm not one to compare, but if Stevie put together a new show arrangement for each tour like Madonna does, I'd be one to attend Stevie's concerts, rather than borrow or buy the
summary: Spiritless, Same Old, Same Old Performances
